Package be.kdg.processor.user.services

Class UserService

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.kdg.processor.user.services.UserService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
    @Service
@Transactional
public class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
    Service used to manipulate Fine information from the H2 in-memory database.
    Author:
    Cédric Goffin
    See Also:
    UserRepository

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserService

        @Autowired
public UserService​(UserRepository userRepository,
                   RoleRepository roleRepository,
                   org.springframework.security.crypto.bcrypt.BCryptPasswordEncoder bCryptPasswordEncoder)
        Constructor for UserService.
        Parameters:
        userRepository - is the repository that has access to the H2 in-memory database user table
        roleRepository - is the repository that has access to the H2 in-memory database role table
        bCryptPasswordEncoder - is the encoder used to encode the user's password

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public java.util.Optional<User> getUser​(java.lang.String username)
                                 throws UserException
        Gets information about a User.
        Parameters:
        username - a string containing a username
        Returns:
        an Optional User. Is empty when no User could be found or when an error occurred.
        Throws:
        UserException - when no User with the supplied username could be found

      • getRole

        public java.util.Optional<Role> getRole​(java.lang.String name)
        Gets information about a User.
        Parameters:
        name - a string containing a role name
        Returns:
        an Optional Role. Is empty when no Role could be found or when an error occurred.

      • save

        public User save​(User user)
          throws UserException
        Method that registers a new user in the repository
        Parameters:
        user - the new user to register
        Returns:
        the registered user from the repository
        Throws:
        UserException - when a user with the same username already exists

      • saveRoles

        public java.util.List<Role> saveRoles​(java.util.List<Role> roles)
        Creates multiple Roles in the repository.
        Parameters:
        roles - a list of Roles that will be persisted to the database
        Returns:
        a list of Roles from the repository that were persisted to the database

      • updateUser

        public User updateUser​(User updatedUser)
                throws UserException
        Method that updates a user in the repository
        Parameters:
        updatedUser - user with updated information
        Returns:
        the updated user from the repository
        Throws:
        UserException - when no user with the supplied username could be found

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser​(java.lang.String username)
                throws UserException
        Method that deletes a user from the repository
        Parameters:
        username - string with username of user that needs to be deleted
        Throws:
        UserException - when no user with the supplied username could be found

        public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails loadUserByUsername​(java.lang.String username)
                                                                             throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
        Gets information about a User. Used by AuthenticationManagerBuilder from spring security.
        Specified by:
        loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
        Parameters:
        username - a string containing a username
        Returns:
        a user
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - when no user could be found with the supplied username
